issues.summary: PMAN: USJ: Supplier History (Audit logs) should be updated, in a Supplier record, when Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle is activated or deactivated.
issues.description: Business Case : When a user activates and or deactivates the Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle, in a Supplier record, then the system should save the setting changes in the Supplier Change History page. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  If a user activates or deactivates the Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle, after the Supplier record was already created, then the system needs to save the setting changes in the Supplier Change History page. Which customers should this change impact?  Customers who have  accountsPayableSettings.autoCalculationStrategies: ['SET_INVOICE_DATE_BASED_ON_MAX_DELIVERY_DATE'] What pages should this change impact?  Master Admin > Suppliers > Supplier Record > Change History page. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins, Buyer (with Manage Suppliers) How should this change work? Pre-condition: Supplier records should already exist in the system. Supplier record is not deleted. Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle =  ON Admin or Buyer (with Manage Suppliers) turns  OFF  this toggle and saves the Supplier record. System saves this as an event on the Change History page. System displays the description of the change as - “The toggle  Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation  was turned  OFF . Use existing implementation for other information such as - Time change, Supplier tab info change, Changes made by, etc. See screenshot below for reference. Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation toggle =  OFF Admin or Buyer (with Manage Suppliers) turns  ON  this toggle and saves the Supplier record. System saves this as an event on the Change History page. System displays the description of the change as - “The toggle  Allow Auto Invoice Date Calculation  was turned  ON . Use existing implementation for other information such as - Time change, Supplier tab info change, Changes made by, etc. See screenshot below for reference. Future enhancements - Once Purchase Team has implemented the Allow Invoice Date Calculation toggle settings in the Bulk upload template, then our system should be able to record the changes made via the Bulk upload file as well in the Change History page. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No Would this change impact existing documents?  No To which teams should this change be communicated to?  Purchase and Integration Teams. FYI -   /   /   /

issues.summary: smartOCI: All catalog items get added to history when even 1 item is updated in upload Catalog using merge & update feature.
issues.description: Business Case: Whenever a new version of catalog is uploaded, all the items of the previous version are moved into the history table.  In case only 1 item is updated in the catalog upload sheet (using “Merge & Update” method), still all the line items are moved into the history table and a new version is saved in the catalog table . This causes the history table to expand rapidly each time there is even a minor change in the catalog items. Use Case is: If a catalog has around 100,000 items Change price in 1 line item All items will have new lastUpdatedDate As there is no change in other items except 1. Implementation is updating all items. So it should only be updated and pushed into history with 1 item. Since we have a limited number of rows quota now. So based on the current implementation we can’t move with this collection into redshift for replication. We may have to rethink the architecture that we have designed. Acceptance Criteria: Change the implementation, so that:  Instead of recording details about the entire catalog being edited, the system should ONLY record details of the items; within the catalog, that have been modified/added/deleted.  This new design needs to cover Overwrite All & Merge and update scenarios We need to handle catalogs in the WORKING column in the catalog manager. Catalogs can only be edited in that column. Modifying a catalog in the other columns is ONLY possible by either creating a “working” copy, or uploading a new file … which then creates a working copy.  cc:  ,  ,  ,    QA  ONLY  needs to test the data replication from MongoDB to Amazon Redshift. There will be  NO  change to the change history report generated from the smartOCI Admin UI.   How to test this? There is a new DB collection, and that’s all we need to look at. Only items that have been deleted from, or updated in a catalog should be added to that collection. Items that have NOT been modified, should NOT be part of that new collection.

issues.summary: Modify mongo connector code to support out of range dates
issues.description:
Our mongo connector throws error and stops working whenever an  out of range date e.g. 20224  is added in  oplog.rs  table of the mongodb local database. Restarting mongo-connector also does not work unless we track and update this data. For right now we can produce this scenerio from invoice creation screen which is discussed in this ticket  . While the suggested validation in this ticket fixes the problem we need to identify and fix within mongo connector as well to support out of range dates or at least it should not crash and stop working. Reason for error: As mentioned in the official pyMongo documentation here at  https://pymongo.readthedocs.io/en/4.2.0/faq.html#why-do-i-get-overflowerror-decoding-dates-stored-by-another-language-s-driver  that this is a driver issue. The updated driver fixes this problem as mentioned here at  https://pymongo.readthedocs.io/en/4.3.2/faq.html#why-do-i-get-overflowerror-decoding-dates-stored-by-another-language-s-driver  by creating the MongoClient with customised date options. We need to solve this problem by using the pyMongo version 4.3.2 and then updating the native mongo-connector code to create MongoClient as mentioned in the documentation.  Both pyMongo versions are supported by mongodb 6 version as mentioned in the official documentation here at  https://www.mongodb.com/docs/drivers/pymongo/#compatibility-table-legend . Both pyMongo versions are also supported by python 3.8 which we are using for mongo-connector as mentioned in the official documentation here at  https://www.mongodb.com/docs/drivers/pymongo/#language-compatibility . Fixation steps Update pyMongo from  4.2.0 to 4.3.2 Open connector.py file located at  /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mongo_connector/connector.py  and update the code as follows (updated file is also attached in this ticket) import  from bson.codec_options import DatetimeConversion  → around line 42 (file attached as well in the ticket) line number around 336 → replace code snipped as  https://github.com/yougov/mongo-connector/pull/938/commits/b2f96d3ed5c7fc5cc527567cff60a1f5a76fb648 client = MongoClient(new_uri, tz_aware=self.tz_aware, **kwargs) //original code
client = MongoClient(new_uri, tz_aware=self.tz_aware, 
datetime_conversion=DatetimeConversion.DATETIME_CLAMP, **kwargs) //replacement Restart Mongo Connector. We have used the  DatetimeConversion.DATETIME_CLAMP  options which reduce the larger year e.g. 20224 to 9999 and any year with negative values to 1. This is the only option which retains the date as valid BSON UTF datetime. Following documentation contains all the available values from which we have chose this option. DATETIME = 1
"""Decode a BSON UTC datetime as a :class:`datetime.datetime`.

BSON UTC datetimes that cannot be represented as a
:class:`~datetime.datetime` will raise an :class:`OverflowError`
or a :class:`ValueError`.

.. versionadded 4.3
"""

DATETIME_CLAMP = 2
"""Decode a BSON UTC datetime as a :class:`datetime.datetime`, clamping
to :attr:`~datetime.datetime.min` and :attr:`~datetime.datetime.max`.

.. versionadded 4.3
"""

DATETIME_MS = 3
"""Decode a BSON UTC datetime as a :class:`~bson.datetime_ms.DatetimeMS`
object.

.. versionadded 4.3
"""

DATETIME_AUTO = 4
"""Decode a BSON UTC datetime as a :class:`datetime.datetime` if possible,
and a :class:`~bson.datetime_ms.DatetimeMS` if not.

.. versionadded 4.3
"""

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: Admin should not see Bulk Upload Options until the feature is completed.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I don’t want to see any Bulk options on the Workflow > Approval Rules page until the feature is completely developed. Acceptance Criteria : Admin should  not  be able to see any bulk option on the Workflow > Approval Rules page until the feature is completely developed. The Admin should  not  be able to see Download Template, Bulk upload & Bulk download buttons on the Approval Rules page. Once the Bulk feature is completely developed, then the Bulk feature should be visible to the admin upon turning this feature toggle on. You can use something like this in the Company Settings for the feature toggle name -  COMPANY_APPROVAL_WORKFLOW_BULK_UPLOAD_VISIBILITY If its too big, please create your own feature toggle name that makes the most sense to you.

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: The system should check multiple fields to identify uniqueness while updating or creating a new Approval Rule via Bulk Upload.
issues.description: Business Case : The system should use the Rule Name, Conditions ( Accounting and Organizational objects ) and Approver(s) to check the uniqueness of the Approval Rule via Bulk Upload. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  The system should perform uniqueness check in order to update an existing Approval Rule. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Rules. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? The system will determine the uniqueness of the Approval Rule by examining the Rule Name and considering the following use cases to determine whether the Approval rule being added via Bulk upload is a new rule or an existing rule that requires updating: - Bulk upload file contains a  new  rule : Rule Name , provided in the Bulk upload file,  does not exists  in the database. Approval Rule  does not belong to the  same  document type (Applies to) if the Combination of Conditions(s) or Approval Chain is the  same  to an existing Approval Rule. Example 1 :  Rule  = Exists in the system;  Rule Name  = Test 1;  Applies To  = PR, CR;   Condition(s)  = Company Code A + Plant A;  Approver(Approval Limit)  = Sujoy (100), Deepak (200). Rule  = New rule added in through Bulk upload;  Rule Name  = Test 2;  Applies To  = Invoice, Memo;   Condition(s)  = Company Code A + Plant A;  Approver(Approval Limit)  = Sujoy (100), Deepak (200). Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file,  does not exist  in the database. Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file, are valid, non-deleted and active. Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file,  does not overlap  with an Existing Parent-Child combination(s). ( Similar to how existing implementation will check for a given combination of filter that is already in use by a workflow ) System assigns the  status  based on the use cases mentioned in this ticket -    Bulk upload file contains an  existing  rule : Rule Name , provided in the Bulk upload file,  does exists  in the database. Do not update existing Approval Rule  if - No changes in document type (Applies To). No changes in Rule Description. No changes in the Combination of Condition(s). No changes in the Approval Chain. No changes to the Status of the Approval rule. No changes to the Deleted option for the Approval rule, in the Bulk upload file. Update existing Approval Rule  if - Changes in document type (Applies To). Changes in Rule Description. Changes in the Combination of Condition(s). Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file,  does exist  in the database. Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file, are valid, non-deleted and active. Combination of the Condition(s) , provided in the Bulk upload file,  should not overlap  with an Existing Parent-Child combination(s). ( Similar to how existing implementation will check for a given combination of filter that is already in use by a workflow ) Changes in the Approval Chain. Note : Approvers should have proper user role, non-deleted, and active. Changes to the Status of the Approval Rule. Check the use cases mentioned in this ticket -    Changes to the Delete option for the Approval rule, in the Bulk upload file. Data provided, in the Bulk upload file, is Invalid or Incorrect : Throw an error for the Approval rule, to the user, explaining the reason for rejecting the Approval rule. Prompt the user to correct the data and re-upload correct data. Refer to the Error report ticket for more details -    User provides the same Approval rule multiple times in the Bulk upload file : Example : Rule 1 and Rule 2. If Rule 1 and Rule 2 are exactly the  same , then Check  “ Bulk upload file contains a  new  rule ”  use case . If it satisfies the above condition, then create a  new  Approval rule for  Rule 1 , and throw an  error  for  Rule 2 , to the user, in the Error report citing “ Duplicate Row Error ”. Check  “ Bulk upload file contains an  existing  rule ”  use case . If it satisfies the above condition, then  update  the existing Approval rule, using data provided in  Rule 1 , and throw an  error  for  Rule 2 , to the user, in the Error report citing “ Duplicate Row Error ” and hence ignore the duplicate data. Check  “ Data provided, in the Bulk upload file, is Invalid or Incorrect ”  use case. If it satisfies the above condition, then throw an  error  for  Rule 1  based on the various  error messages  provided in   or based on the  current implementation , that is present on the UI. Throw an  error  for  Rule 2 , to the user, in the Error report citing “ Duplicate Row Error ” and hence ignore the duplicate data. If Rule 1 and Rule 2 have  same   Rule Name  but  different   information  such as - “Applies To / Rule Description / Combination of Condition(s) / Combination of Approval Chain / Status / Delete” from each other, then Consider  Rule 1  as the  main data  and throw an  error  for  Rule 2 , to the user, in the Error report citing “ Duplicate Row Error ” and hence ignore the data provided in Rule 2. Check  “ Bulk upload file contains a  new  rule ”  and  “ Bulk upload file contains an  existing  rule ”  use case for  Rule 1  to see which use case it satisfies. No data provided : Do nothing, no action required. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: Admin can change the status of the Approval Rules through bulk upload.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I want to change the status of the Approval Rule(s) through bulk upload. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Admin should be able to change the status of the Approval Rule(s) using Bulk upload file. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Rules. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? Status is an  optional  input column in the Approval Rule upload file. The Admin should be able to provide: Active (for activating an Approval Rule) Value = “Active” Inactive (for deactivating an Approval Rule) Value = “Inactive” Status Column Approval Rule Previous Status Value = “Empty” Value = “Active” Value = “Inactive” Exists New None Active (Default) Active Inactive Exists Existing Active No Change Active (Keep) Inactive (Change) Exists Existing Inactive No Change Active (Change) Inactive (Keep) Does not Exist New None Active (Default) Does not Exist Existing Active Active (Default) Does not Exist Existing Inactive Inactive (Default) Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date Does it make sense to keep the status as Active by default for a new Approval Rule when the Status column exists?    Sujoy

issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I want to download the Approval Rules Bulk Upload Template, so that I can fill in the desired fields and upload the file. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Admin should be able to download the Approval Rules Bulk upload Template using the Download Template icon. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Rules > Download Template. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? There should be a Download Template icon above the top right corner of the Approval Rule table on the Approval Rule screen. Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying Download Template. Clicking on the  Download Template  icon should download the template in the .xlsx format. The name of the downloaded file should be “ Approval-Rules-Bulk-Upload-Template”. In the download template, there should be 2 tabs (sheets): Approval Rules Bulk Upload In this sheet (tab), the following columns should be there: (Please create their enums according to the existing bulk upload standards in our system.) Row Number Applies To Rule Name Rule Description All the Company Object fields Company Code ( currently supported ) All the Accounting Object fields Plant ( currently supported ) Cost Center ( currently supported ) GL Account ( currently supported ) Location ( currently supported ) Project ( currently supported ) Level 1 Approver Level 1 Approver’s Approval Limit Level 2 to 5 Approver ( separate columns for each level of Approver ) Level 2 to 5 Approver’s Approval Limit ( separate columns for each level of Approver’s Approval Limit ) Status Delete Instructions In this sheet (tab), the instructions for each column’s input from the Approval Rules Upload Upload sheet should be there. For reference, please click on the following .xlsx file. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

issues.summary: Payables: Approval WF: Admin can upload the Approval Rules via Bulk Upload file.
issues.description: Business Case : As an  Admin , I want to be able to upload the Approval Rules via Bulk Upload file, so that the system can use them for document validation. Acceptance Criteria : What is the change?  Admin should be able to upload the Approval Rules Bulk upload file using the Upload Approval Rules icon. Which Customer should this change impact?  All customers using the new Approval Workflow feature toggle. What pages should this change impact?  Company > Workflow > Approval Rules. Which users should be impacted by the change?  Admins. How should this change work? There should be an Upload Approval Rules icon above the top right corner of the Approval Rules table on the Approval Rules screen. ( The following image is just for reference. ) Hovering on the icon should show a tooltip saying Upload Approval Rules. Clicking on the Upload Approval Rules should open a window where users can select and upload the bulk upload file. Upon Selecting the file, the system should validate the bulk upload file to verify all the data is valid. In case of valid data in the bulk upload file, the system should save the Approval Rules uploaded via bulk upload in the DB. There should be a green noty message stating that the file has been uploaded successfully. They should start appearing in the Approval Rules table. If there are errors in the files, the system should generate an error report which the user can download. (refer to the ticket -  ). There should a red noty message stating that the file has been failed to upload or there are errors in the file. Here is the attached template file that should be used for the Approval Rules bulk upload. There is one optional column  Delete   in the bulk upload file. It is a flag type - (true or false). The user can use it to delete the existing record in the system through bulk upload. The user can provide  X   in the column to mark the  DELETED  flag true. The Approval Rule with the  DELETED  flag  true  should be soft-deleted and kept in the DB. The system should keep it in the DB with the  DELETED  flag true if the user marks the  DELETED  flag true for the Approval Rule that has never existed in the system before. Please open the  Instructions  of the attached sheet to understand the validations of each field (column) present in the bulk upload file. As an example for Company Code column, Admin can use any one of the below formats during  Upload : Company Code A Company Code A, Company Code B Company Code A | Company Code A description Company Code A | Company Code A description, Company Code B | Company Code B description Similarly other Accounting objects like - Plant, GL Account, Cost Center, Location and Project should be able to follow the same format as shown above for  Upload . The column names (fields) should be  case-insensitive . The system should support  custom labels  for accounting and company objects in the bulk upload file as column (field) names.  ( For now we’ll skip custom label support for accounting objects which we can focus in a future release like RC-2024-4 or RC-2024-5 ) The system should support bulk upload file in .XLSX format. Do we need a data fix for existing customers?  No. Would this change impact existing documents?  No. To which teams should this change be communicated to?  All. Questions : Question # AC # Raised By Inquiry Date Assignee Response Date

In this phase, we will cover the following areas: Purchase Request Accounting Validation on PR Creation: Bulk Upload RFQ to PR Cart to PR API Blank PR template(not applicable) Accounting Validation at: Add/ Update line item Line item bulk upload Apply to All Purchase Order Accounting Validation on PO Creation: Creation from Buy Route Creation from PO wizard API Accounting Validation at Add/ Update line item Apply to All Apart from that, in this epic, we will improve the UX for the accounting validation process.

issues.summary: AccVal: On updating draft state PR that is already having warnings system stop displaying those error messages until user reloads the page
issues.description: Server devqa2 Steps to Reproduce: Login from employee, create PR having invalid accounting string Click on submit button  Submit button will display validating data and then view error(s) button  Click on View Error(s) and verify error messages Now copy any line item and verify that error message stop displaying  Expected Result: System will display warning error message until user fix those errors Actual Result: System stop displaying error message on PR when user add new line item, update header of PR or make any change on PR. System start displaying it again when user reload the page

issues.summary: AccVal: PR Creation via Copy PR: The system should run the accounting validation when PR is created via Copy PR.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run accounting validation when the item PR is created via Copy PR. Acceptance Criteria: Existing Implementation of Copy PR: The PR can be copied after it is submitted  When the user clicks the  Copy Purchase Request  button: The system creates a new PR The system navigates the user to the newly created PR The system copies everything at header level and line item level to the newly created PR. General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Document Creation: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. Copy PR: When the user clicks the  Copy Purchase Request  button, the system should navigate the user to the newly created PR. ( existing implementation ) While loading the newly created PR: The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  in the user’s profile. The system should run the validation on the PR load as defined in    If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. The system should show the accounting strings error message box above the line item grid. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  in the selected user’s profile. The system should run the validation on the PR load as defined in    If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. The system should show the accounting strings error message box above the line item grid.

issues.summary: PR Update/Submission/Deleted via API: The system should show the noty message when the user is on the PR and it is updated via API.
issues.description: Business Case: As a user, if I am on the PR while it is being updated via API, I should be notified about it. Acceptance Criteria: If the user is on the PR document and has been updated via API, the system should notify the user through a Noty message. The noty message should be blue. It should be a non-slider The message should be “This PR has been updated. Click here to Refresh.“ The  Click here to Refresh  will be a link. Clicking on that will refresh that page with updated PR information. The noty message should block the user from performing any action on the PR until they refresh the page. The system should show the noty message when PR is updated using the following APIs: Update Purchase Request Status (POST Type) Update Purchase Request with ID (PUT Type) Update Purchase Request with PR Number (PUT Type) Submit Purchase Request with ID (POST Type) Submit Purchase Request with PR Number (POST Type) Once the PR is refreshed, the system should show the accounting validation meaning message accordingly if any invalid accounting strings were identified during the accounting process at the PR update via API. The following are the APIs from the above list where the system runs the accounting validation process: Update Purchase Request with ID (PUT Type) Update Purchase Request with PR Number (PUT Type) Submit Purchase Request with ID (POST Type) Submit Purchase Request with PR Number (POST Type) If the user is on the PR document and has been deleted via API, the system should notify the user through a Noty message. The noty message should be blue. It should be a non-slider The message should be “This PR has been deleted. Click here to Refresh.“ The  Click here to Refresh  will be a link. Clicking on that will navigate the user to the PR listing screen. The system should show the noty message when PR is deleted using the following APIs: Delete Purchase Request with ID (DELETE Type) Delete Purchase Request with PR Number (DELETE Type) Here is the link of Vroozi API Documentation:

issues.summary: AccVal: PO via RFQ: The system should run the accounting validation while creating PO from RFQ
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run accounting validation when the PO is created via the Buy Route. Acceptance Criteria: Existing Implementation of PO Creation via RFQ: When the Buy Route is on, The buyer selects the item(s) of the PR from the  Ready for Sourcing  grid. The system moves the selected item(s) to the  Selected for Sourcing  grid. The buyer clicks the ellipsis on the  Prepare PO  button. The buyer clicks the  Prepare RFQ  option. The system asks the buyer to add the list of suppliers to which the buyer wants to send the RFQ. The buyer clicks the  Create RFQ  button. The system creates the RFQ in the Draft state with line items that the buyer selected from the  Ready for Sourcing  grid. The suppliers receive that RFQ via email. The suppliers then bid on the RFQ. The user who created the RFQ can see the bids from different suppliers on the RFQ. The user then can award the bid to one of the suppliers. The user then creates Purchase Order for the awarded bid. The system creates the PO in the DRAFT state in the background and assigns it to the selected buyer. While creating the PO, the line items keep the accounting and organization objects that were assigned to them in the PR. General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Document Creation: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. Create Purchase Order for the Awarded Bid of RFQ: The system creates the PO in the DRAFT state and assigns it to the selected buyer when the PO is created for the awarded bid of the RFQ. While creating the PO, the system keeps all the line item information that is coming from the PR including accounting combination. While creating the PO in the background: The system should not run the accounting validation if it does not find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . In that case, when the requester opens(loads) the PO, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. When the requester opens(loads) the PO, the system should not run the accounting validation at the document load as no existing accounting errors are found. ( existing implementation ) If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. When the requester opens(loads) the PO, the system should re-run the accounting validation at the document load as it finds the existing accounting errors. ( existing implementation ) The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in all the required and optional fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the system finds no accounting string errors, the system should save the state in the DB. When the requester opens(loads) the PO, the system should not run the accounting validation at the document load as no existing accounting errors are found. ( existing implementation ) If the system finds the accounting string errors, the system should save them in the DB. When the requester opens(loads) the PO, the system should re-run the accounting validation at the document load as it finds the existing accounting errors. ( existing implementation )

issues.summary: AccVal: PR via Bulk Upload from the Wizard: The system should run the validation while creating PR from Bulk Upload
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run the accounting validation when the PR is created via Bulk Upload. Acceptance Criteria: Existing Implementation of PR Bulk Upload: The user clicks the  Bulk Upload Request  from the  Create  option of the left navigation menu. A wizard appears, where the user clicks the  Line Item Bulk Upload File  button to upload the file.  Then the user clicks the  Create Purchase Request  button. A push notification appears at the bottom right corner of the screen telling the user that the file is in progress. If the file is processed without any errors, PR is created in the background. The notification tells the user that the file is processed successfully. There is a link. Clicking on that navigates the user with the newly created PR. If the file is processed with errors, PR is created in the background with the errors. The notification tells the user that the file is processed with errors. There is a link. Clicking on that navigates the user with the newly created PR. There is another link. Clicking on that downloads the error report for the user. While Creating the PR, the system prioritizes the accounting and organization objects' values in the BOM file. The system checks the user’s profile for accounting and organization objects' values if not found. If not found, the system leaves those fields empty. General Rule for Running the Accounting Validation at Document Creation: Currently, the system requires the definition of the required and optional Accounting/Organization objects in the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service . If the value in the optional field is given at the line item, the system considers it for the accounting validation in addition to the required fields. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. issues.summary: AccVal: PR via Cart: The system should run the accounting validation when item is moved from Cart to PR
issues.description: Business Case: The system should run accounting validation when the item is moved from the Cart to PR. When the user moves an item from Cart to PR, the system creates the PR and navigates the user to it: Existing Implementation of Move Item from Cart to PR: When the user moves an item from Cart to PR, the system creates the PR and navigates the user to it. The system checks the user’s profile to fill in the accounting and organization fields on the line items. If found, the system fills in the accounting and organization fields on the line items with default values from the user profile. If not found, the system leaves the accounting and organization fields empty on the line items. The system shows the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. Items from the cart can potentially have the category-based GL assigned to them. While moving such items from Cart to PR, the system checks the given GL is paired with the Company Code value from the user’s profile. If yes, the category-based GL is assigned to the item on the PR. If not, the GL that is paired with the Company Code from the user’s profile is assigned to the site on the PR.  While moving such items from Cart to PR, if no Company Code value is found in the user’s profile, the system assigns the category-based GL to the item on the PR. If the value in the optional field is not given at the line item, the system considers only the values in the required fields at the line item for the accounting validation. Based on that, the system decided what fields should be compared in the accounting validation with the accounting string master data. In that case, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should not run the accounting validation if it does not find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  in the user’s profile. In that case, the system should show the missing fields error message according to the document-level field configuration. The system should run the accounting validation if it does find values in at least all the required fields for the  Accounting Validation Configuration Service  in the user’s profile. issues.summary: AccVal: PO-Submit-Load-UX: The user should be able to see the in-progress icon in the submit button instead of the overlay.
issues.description: Business Case: The system should show the  in-progress  icon in the  Submit  button for Accounting Validation when the user clicks it on the Purchase Order. Acceptance Criteria: PO/POCR Submit: When the user clicks the  Submit  button, the system shows the overlays for  Accounting Validation In Progress ,  Completed Successfully , and  Accounting Validation Failed . Now, we are going to change the UX. The system should not show the overlays mentioned above anymore. Dynamic Submit button labels: Once the user clicks the  Submit  button on the PO, the  Submit  button label should change to  Validating Data . Once the user clicks the  Submit  button, all other action buttons and fields on the PO should become disabled. ( Existing implementation ) An  In Progress  Icon should be visible after the  Validating Data  label on the button. If the user reloads the document in the  Validating Data  state, the system loses all the progress on the POCR document. The system should navigate the user to the screen accordingly if the Accounting Validation is completed successfully. ( Existing implementation ) The system should change the button’s label from  Validating Data  to  View Error(s)  if the Accounting Validation is completed and error(s) are identified. Clicking on the  View Error(s)  button should scroll the user to the Accounting Validation Error(s) message box above the Line Item grid. Once the user clicks the  View Error(s)  button, the system should revert the label to  Submit .  The  Submit  button should remain disabled until all the accounting Validation errors are resolved. ( Existing implementation ) If the user scrolls up without clicking the  View Error(s)  button, the system should keep the  View Error(s)  button until the user doesn’t change the state of the document. ( Added on    ) If the user updates the document without clicking the  View Error(s)  button, the system should change the label of the button from  View Error(s)  to  Submit . ( Added on    ) The following actions can update the document in the DB: ( Added on    ) Change in Header level fields. Change in Header level custom fields. Update existing line items. (from all avenues) Add new line items(from all avenues) Add notes/supplier notes Kindly do the impact analysis and find out if anything is missing from the above list. All the requirements mentioned should be implemented on the POCR screen as well irrespective of the user doing the POCR. Highlight the Accounting Validation Error(s) message box: Once the system scrolls the user to the Accounting Validation Error(s) message box above the Line Item grid after the  View Error(s)  button is clicked, the borders of the Accounting Validation Error(s) message box should be highlighted. The highlighted border should fade away gradually. PO Load: When the system loads the PO document that has the accounting string error(s), it runs the accounting validation to re-validate the invalid accounting strings. In this process, the system shows the overlays for  Accounting Validation In Progress ,  Completed Successfully , and  Accounting Validation Failed . Now, we are going to change the UX. The system should not show the overlays mentioned above anymore. Silkscreen on the Line Item grid: When the system loads the PO and accounting validation is in progress, the system should display the silkscreen covering the line item grid. On the silkscreen, there should be a text  Validating Data  visible. An  In Progress  Icon should be visible after the text  Validating Data. The silkscreen should prevent the user from clicking anything from the line item grid. The system should disable all the action button(s) on the PO while the accounting validation process is in progress. The user should be able to edit all the header-level fields and custom fields that do not directly impact the line items. In case of any update, the system should save the changes in those header and custom fields. The system should disable the header level field  Shipping Address  while the accounting validation process is in progress. (Please let me know if any other header level field that impacts the line items directly) Once the accounting validation process is completed: The silkscreen from the line item grid should disappear. All the action buttons should be enabled. All the disabled header fields should be enabled. The system should show the accounting string error message above the line item grid for the line items having invalid accounting strings. ( existing implementation )  PO Creation Avenues: Team, since it was requested to mention the avenues from where the PO can be created. Please note that the following information is just to help the team understand what possible avenues can be used to create the PO creation manually. Here is the list: PO Creation Wizard PO Creation from Buy Route Check with the Purchase team if there is a way in case on Supplier Outpur method is not given and the PO is created in Draft state. The following users can create the PO manually from the above-mentioned avenues: Admin Buyer

In case of any update, the system should save the changes in those header and custom fields. The system should disable the header level field  Shipping Address  while the accounting validation process is in progress. (Please let me know if any other header level field that impacts the line items directly) Once the accounting validation process is completed: The silkscreen from the line item grid should disappear. All the action buttons should be enabled. All the disabled header fields should be enabled. The system should show the accounting string error message above the line item grid for the line items having invalid accounting strings. ( existing implementation ) All the requirements mentioned above requirements should be implemented for the following users who can take action on the PR: Requester Sourcing Approver Financial Approver Budget Approver

issues.summary: JSESSIONID TLS cookie without secure flag set ( smartOCI )
issues.description: Issue detail The following cookies were issued by the application and do not have the secure flag set: JSESSIONID AWSALB (This is set by awslb, this is not controlled by VROOZI so we cannot set this value) The highlighted cookie appears to contain a session token, which may increase the risk associated with this issue. You should review the contents of the cookies to determine their function.

issues.summary: Cross-site scripting (reflected) ( smartOCI )
issues.description: The value of the  localeLanguage  request parameter is copied into the HTML document as plain text between tags. The payload  }}f665l<script>alert(1)</script>gogwx  was submitted in the localeLanguage parameter. This input was echoed as  f665l<script>alert(1)</script>gogwx  in the application's response. This proof-of-concept attack demonstrates that it is possible to inject arbitrary JavaScript into the application's response.

epic.description: We need to upgrade mongoDB version to version 6.x (latest at the time of this writing) Potential areas of interests for upgrade: new features, security + performance gains, using latest version of our core technology  multi level transaction support  free cloud monitoring  change streams  schema validations  client-side field level encryption  mongodb connector for kafka  time series collection  stable API  cluster to cluster sync  sharded clusters mongodb Charts + Data lake -> Atlas Seems we will need to follow a successive update path: 3.2 → 3.4 → 3.6 → 4.0 → 4.2 → 4.4 → 5.0 → 6.0

issues.summary: Spring data compatibility issue fix
issues.description: After careful consideration of multiple versions of Spring Data MongoDB, the closest yet most compatible version found was 3.3.10. Following versions of Spring Data had been tried. 4.0.0 ❌ (Compilation Errors) 3.4.18 ❌  3.4.16 ❌ 3.4.15 ❌ 3.4.14 ❌ 3.4.9 ❌ 3.4.6 ❌ 3.4.5 ❌ 3.4.2 ❌ 3.4.1 ❌ 3.4.0 ❌ 3.3.10 ✅ After studying the changelog of releases between 3.3.10 and 3.4.15, nothing of concern has been identified. The version of Spring Data MongoDB being used in Vroozi’s SpringBoot projects is 3.3.4.

issues.summary: Vroozi API - List of Items from a catalog with filtering of status and date range
issues.description: As an API user, we need to support filtering on the list of Catalog Items API. These filter options should support filter by Status, and date range on the lastUpdatedDate field. status - APPROVED, PUBLISHED lastUpdatedDate - range                                  fromDate - 2024-01-25 → (2024-01-25t00:00:00.000Z)                                   toDate - 2024-01-26 → (2024-01-26t23:59:59.999Z) Technical Details: Add support for the following filtering options on the Catalog Items GET API  /catalogs /{id}/items and /catalogs/{name}/items Add filtering by  Status , All Catalog Status can be passed as filters Support single status and multiple status, when providing multiple status, separate them by comma(,) If wrong value is provided in the status, there should be a validation error ignore the comma at the end of the filter e.g APPROVED and APPROVED, should result in same result APPROVED, PUBLISHED should filter all the catalog items in APPROVED and PUBLISHED status, the results are sorted by lastUpdatedDate Added filtering by lastUpdatedDate, when providing the filter by this date, there should be two fields to provide the date range, We already have the field  Da  exposed in the API, we need additional  lastUpdatedBefore . When providing the filter options, all the fields are optional. If dates are provided then the following conditions should be considered only lastUpdatedAfter is provided in the filters, Return all results after this date, if the date is provided in date-only format, consider the time of the end of the day, e.g 01/29/2024 is provided than filter all records after 01/29/2024 t 00:00:00.000 only lastUpdatedBefore is provided in the filters, Return all results before this date, if the date is provided in date only format, consider the time of the start of the day, e.g 01/29/2024 is provided then filter all records after 01/29/2024 t 00:00:00.000 If both the dates are provided then consider the records between provided date ranges. If the date is provided in date only format, consider the following rule (lastUpdateAfter - lastUpdatedBefore). e.g 01/27/2024 t 00:00:00.000 - 01/29/2024 t 00:00:00.000 will filter all the records from the 01/28/2024 If the fields are provided in the wrong format, then we need to provide a validation error, the end date cannot be before the start date.  Sort by should be by the last updated date field. Update the Vroozi API documentation to expose these additional query parameters. Dates should be accepted in the supported formats. Testing from Swagger UI and Postman should be performed. Error Messages: https://smartoci.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TS/pages/3759243283/Error+Messages+and+Details

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Add support for Catalog Content Groups upsert (POST and PUT) (Master Data)
Making Section for Catalog APIs in swagger documentation.
issues.description: We need to make sections for catalog APIs in the Swagger documentation. We should have this Sequence in the docs for client ease to understand the proper flow. Catalog APIs. Catalogs Catalog Items Catalog Items File Upload Content View Associations Custom Fields Details Endpoints with sections. Catalogs: GET /catalogs   Get list of Catalogs   GET  /catalogs/{id}   Get Catalog by ID GET  /catalogs/name/{name}   Get Catalog By name GET  /catalogs/published   Get Published Catalogs GET   /catalogs/{id}/items   Get List of Catalog Items GET   /catalogs/async-requests/{trackingId}   Progress status of async request by Tracking Id POST  /catalogs   Create Catalog POST   /catalogs/{id}/status-update  Update Catalog Status By Id POST  /catalogs/name/{name}/status-update   Update Catalog Status By Name PUT  /catalogs/{id}  Update Catalog by ID PUT   /catalogs/name/{name}  Update Catalog by name DELETE  /catalogs/{id}   Delete Catalog by ID DELETE  /catalogs/name/{name}   Delete Catalog by name Catalog Items: GET /catalogs/{id}/items/{itemId}   Get Catalog Item by Id GET   /catalogs/name/{name}/items/{itemId}   Get catalog Items POST   /catalogs/{id}/items/upsert/async   Uploads items to the Catalog. POST   /catalogs/name/{name}/items/upsert/async   Uploads Catalog items to the Catalog by name POST   /catalogs/{id}/items/upsert   Upsert Catalog Item POST   /catalogs/name/{name}/items/upsert   Upsert catalog by Catalog Name. DELETE   /catalogs/{id}/items/{itemId}   Delete catalog Item by ID. DELETE   /catalogs/name/{name}/items/{itemId}   Delete Catalog Item Catalog Items File Upload POST   /catalogs/{id}/upload  Upload Catalog Items using file POST   /catalogs/name/{name}/upload   Upload Catalog Items using file Content View Associations: POST  /catalogs/{id}/content-views/associations    Associate the given content views with the catalog by id/externalId POST  /catalogs/name/{name}/content-views/associations   Associate the given content views with the catalog by name POST   /catalogs/{id}/content-views/associate  Associate the given content views with the catalog by id/externalId POST   /catalogs/name/{name}/content-views/associate   Associate the given content views with the catalog by name PUT  /catalogs/{id}/content-views/remove   Remove the association(s) from the existing catalog by id/externalId PUT  /catalogs/name/{name}/content-views/remove   Remove the association(s) from the existing catalog by name Custom Fields: POST  /catalogs/{id}/custom-fields/associate  Associate the given custom fields with the catalog by id POST  /catalogs/name/{name}/custom-fields/associate  Associate the given custom fields with the catalog by name PUT  /catalogs/{id}/custom-fields/remove  Remove the association(s) from the existing catalog by id PUT  /catalogs/name/{name}/custom-fields/remove  Remove the association(s) from the existing catalog by name

issues.summary: Vroozi API - Add support for Catalog Content views GET and DELETE (Master Data)
issues.description: GET by Id/externalId GET LIST with standard filtering DELETE  id/externalId Acceptance Criteria: 1.  GET by Id/externalId: /content-views/{id} Scenario 1:  When a valid Id/externalId is provided: /content-views/{id} The system should return the content view with the specified Id. useExternalId header must be used if the provided id is externalId. Verify that the response contains the expected content view details. Ensure the response includes relevant information such as Id, externalId, and name. Scenario 2:  When an invalid Id/externalId is provided: /content-views/{id} The system should return an error message indicating that the content view with the specified Id is not found. Verify that the response includes a clear error message. 2.  GET LIST with standard filtering by lastUpdatedDateAfter, sort options: Scenario 1:  When no filters are applied: The system should return a list of all content view with standard pagination support, default 25 size and max 100 size of the page. Verify that the response includes relevant information for each content view. Scenario 2:  When filters for date range are applied: The system should return a filtered list based on the specified date range. Verify that the response includes only content views that fall within the specified date range. Scenario 3:  When sorting options are applied: The system should return a sorted list based on the specified sorting options. Verify that the response includes content views sorted according to the specified criteria. 3.  DELETE by id/externalId: Scenario 1:  When a valid Id is provided: The system should delete the content view with the specified Id. Verify that the response indicates a successful deletion. Scenario 2:  When an invalid Id is provided: The system should return an error message indicating that the content view with the specified Id is not found. Verify that the response includes a clear error message. Scenario 3:  When attempting to delete a content view that is referenced in a content group The system should remove that association from the content group.

epic.summary: Enhancement of Terms & Conditions Management and Assignment in Purchase Orders
epic.description: Description Objective: This Epic aims to significantly enhance the Terms & Conditions (T&Cs) management and assignment functionalities in our system, addressing specific needs of our clients, Yukon and Maersk. The primary goal is to provide flexibility and control in the creation, assignment, and management of T&Cs for Purchase Orders (POs), both auto-generated and manually created. Key Features: Admin Capabilities for T&Cs Management: Enable Company Admins to author and manage multiple custom T&Cs. Provide functionality to set default T&Cs and associate custom T&Cs with specific suppliers and/or company codes. Dynamic T&Cs Assignment: Automate the assignment of correct T&Cs to POs based on supplier and/or company code. Buyer Permissions & Capabilities: Empower Buyers with permissions to edit T&Cs on POs, including the use of a rich text editor for ad-hoc T&Cs, with options to save these either for single-use or in their profile for future reuse. PO Change Request (POCR) Enhancements: Implement functionality for Buyers to update T&Cs on POs via POCR, with tracking of changes in the document history UI. Restricted Access for Requesters: Prevent the original requester from altering T&Cs on POs through the POCR function. Admin Overrides and Approvals: Allow Admins to modify T&Cs on POs via POCR, subject to Buyer approval for manually created/transmitted POs. Stakeholders: Primary: Yukon and Maersk Vroozi Divisions: Management, Sales / Marketing, Customer Success, Implementation, Support, Product, Engineering Vroozi Functional teams: Purchase Team, Payables Team ( — ?), Integration Team ( ?) Timeline and Milestones: Start Date: ASAP Completion Target: May 2024, within Q2 2024 Dependencies and Risks: Application Roles Effected : Company Admins, Buyers Payables Team Cooperation: Required for updating POs in the Supplier Portal. Integration Team Involvement: Potential need for integrating T&Cs communication via cXML POs, which could impact project timeline. Success Criteria: Effective implementation of T&Cs management and assignment system enhancements. Improved flexibility and control for Admins and Buyers in handling T&Cs. Seamless integration with existing systems and processes. Positive feedback from primary stakeholders, Yukon and Maersk. Milestones: MVP - Minimum Viable Product: Product manager to validate assumptions and solution design with stakeholders. Engineering to complete    MUP - Minimum Useable Product:                                     Purchase Order: Allow Buyers to create and associate Ad-hoc T&Cs to a specific PO Purchase Order: Print the correct T&Cs on the PO PDF Vroozi Admin: Allow Admins to specify whether PO T&Cs can be updated via the POCR function POCR: Allow only the “PO Owner” to update T&Cs via POCR POCR: Record and display T&Cs changes done on a PO, in the PO Document Change History Integration team  → SPIKE: Integration team needs to investigate impact on NBCU, if T&Cs can be updated vai POCR Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Display PO T&Cs in the Vroozi Supplier Portal Payables team  → Supplier Portal: Ensure SP users are able to Confirm / Dispute T&Cs changes on a PO updated via POCR MLP - Minimum Lovable Product: Vroozi Admin: Figure out how to introduce an “Apply to All” option for associations SPIKE: Investigate how we can compute, store and display a fine grained “Diff” for the T&Cs content, when updated by an Admin         Integration team  →     POCR: Allow Admins to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Allow Central Reciever to update the T&Cs on a PO via POCR POCR: Ensure that T&Cs updates on POs; done via POCR, are reviewed and approved by the “PO Owner” Vroozi PMAN: Allow Buyers, Admins, Central Receivers to create custom T&Cs and save them in their user profile for reuse at a later date Vroozi PMAN: Allow users to view and manage their custom T&Cs from their “My Data” screen   The wireframes for this project can also be found here:

issues.summary: Vroozi Admin : Add a table to display a list of custom T&Cs in the unitID
issues.description: Business Case: The purpose of this ticket is to address the need for an enhanced user interface within the Vroozi Admin system for displaying custom Terms & Conditions (T&Cs). The current UI for T&Cs is slated for replacement to improve usability, functionality, and visual appeal. This enhancement is expected to facilitate easier navigation and management of T&Cs for administrators, particularly in the context of different unit IDs. By introducing a new table format, administrators can efficiently view, manage, and understand the specific T&Cs associated with each unit ID, leading to better compliance management and a more user-friendly experience. What’s wrong with the current UI?   The current UI is only meant to handle a single set of custom T&Cs for a unitID. It displays a single rich text editor, which allows the Admins to define the custom T&Cs that the unitID will use. This bakes in the assumption that there will always be just one set of T&Cs that will be used across all POs that the unitID issues to all suppliers.  What value will the updated UI bring? This new UI will be inspired by other data tables used in the application, specifically the ones used on the various document status screens. E.g. Purchase Orders. This will enable the display, creation, deletion, editing of an arbitrary number of custom T&Cs that an Admin might want to maintain for the unitID.  The data table format will allow the system to list any number of custom T&Cs for the unitID. Allowing the Admin to perform various operations on these T&Cs, either on a singular basis, or collectively. The new UI will support standard CRUD functionality, and will even grow to offer bulk upload/download functionality.  Acceptance Criteria: Prerequisites: If the feature flag added in   has not been removed from the system. Then the unitID MUST have this feature flag enabled.    Impacted Vroozi Roles Which user roles within the Vroozi Admin system will be affected by this change? PMAN Admin Data-Fix Necessity   Will there be any requirement for data migration or transformation as part of this change? TBD … If required, please provide details of what the expected effect of this data fix will be:  TBD … Change this …  To this …                                                                                +  Ignore the following UI elements from the wireframes for the scope of this ticket: The Bulk Upload/Download UI controls The Default Terms & Conditions label and drop-down The search/filter bar Default set of requirements for the new data table: When a user clicks into the existing “ Terms & Conditions “ drop-down and selects the “ Custom Terms & Conditions “ option, the system should display a new data table, with the following columns:  <Row selection checkboxes> Name Description Associated with …  Created by Created on Status <Row action controls> The following columns should be sortable:  Name Created by Created on There should be 3 action buttons under the data grid:  Activate Deactivate Add T&Cs How should the system behave when there are no custom T&Cs available in the unitID? If there are no custom T&Cs currently created for the unitID, the system should display a placeholder message in lieu of the rows in the table. This message should read “ Could not find any existing custom Terms & Conditions. Please create a new set of Terms & Conditions by clicking on "Add T&Cs".  “ Unless there is at least 1 set of custom T&Cs in the data table, only the “ Add T&Cs ” button should be in an active/clickable state.  How should the system behave when 1 or more custom T&Cs are available in the unitID? By default, the system should display custom T&Cs on this data table, sorted by creation date; i.e. the “ Created on  “ column, in reverse chronological order (latest → oldest). The  Name  field should display the mandatory name assigned to each set of custom T&Cs.  The value displayed in this column should be clickable The  Description  field should display upto 50 characters from the optional description in each set of custom T&Cs, if available.  The  Associated with …  field should display upto 3 of the suppliers and/or company codes that the custom T&Cs are associated with.  If there is a single supplier and/or company code that the custom T&C is associated with, then the system should just list those values. If there is nothing to show, display an “ N/A ”. For 2 or more values display the keyworkd “Multiple ( x )“; where “x” is the number of values that were returned by the BE.  Upon clicking on this keyword, the system should display a list of the values represented by the count in the (), in a too-tip. See the implementation on the Purchase Orders data grid for ference.  The associated suppliers should be listed first, followed by the associated company codes in the next line.  The  Created by  column should list the name of the user that created a given set of custom T&Cs.  The  Created on  column should list the date on which a given set of custom T&Cs was created in the unitID. This field should use the same default date format used in the entire unitID.  The  Status  column should display one of the following statuses for each row: Active Inactive Question Answer Q asked by …  Q asked on … A provided by … A provided on … What symbol should be added to the last column’s header in the new table? Leave the header empty for now. If needed, I’ll create another ticket to add a symbol there.          What are the options that we will show in the action menu in the last column in the new table? Ultimately, I want 3 options in the menu: Make these the default T&Cs  Copy Delete However, this will be handled in a separate ticket. For now, just make sure there’s an extra column at the end of the table, that we can use to give the user options for performing actions related to a given set of T&Cs.

issues.summary: System : Add a DB level feature flag to control the functionality developed in VZI-95348
issues.description: Business Case: We need to add a DB level feature flag to enable/disable this functionality. The entire purpose for this is so that we can merge the new/updated code into the main codebase, without having to maintain long running feature branches. This feature flag will be removed at a future date, when the feature enhancement is considered mature enough to be released to all Vroozi customers.  Acceptance Criteria: Add a new DB level feature flag that will allow us to enable/disable the updated T&Cs functionality for specific unitIDs, or for all customers.
